snippet: Rachel Noerdlinger, the chief of staff to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, said that after the arrest of her son on Friday, she believed she needed to spend more time with her family.
abstract: Rachel Noerdlinger, chief of staff to New York City's first lady Chirlane McCray, announces she will take indefinite leave of absence, first significant shake-up of Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration; departure comes after months of damaging reports about Noerdlinger, and is illustrative of de Blasio's personal confidence, unwavering defense of personnel, and tendency toward defiance in face of criticism.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART
byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and Sandra E. Garcia contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Rachel Noerdlinger, the chief of staff to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, said that after the arrest of her son on Friday, she believed she needed to spend more time with her family.

headline.main: Rachel Noerdlinger, a Top City Hall Aide, Takes a Leave of Absence
headline.print_headline: A Wrenching Exit at City Hall
